alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 10:59AM MST until September 10 at 12:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM MST/130 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR PORTIONS OF THE COLORADO RIVER NEAR THE GRAND CANYON IN COCONINO COUNTY... At 1057 AM MST /1157 AM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain from thunderstorms has decreased in intensity across the warned area. However, between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly as water drains. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hermit`s Rest At Grand Canyon, Pima Point At Grand Canyon, Grand Canyon National Park and Havasupai Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Shinumo Creek, Salt Creek, Bright Angel Creek, Heather Wash, Boucher Creek, Hermit Creek, Milk Creek, Monument Creek, Trinity Creek, Colorado River, Tuna Creek, Havasu Creek, Hundred and Twentyeight Mile Creek, Crystal Creek, Coconino Wash, Pasture Wash, Dragon Creek, Flint Creek, Prairie Wash, Hundred and Twenty Mile Creek, Ninetyone Mile Creek, Hundred and Twentyseven Mile Creek, Royal Arch Creek and Phantom Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
